Write a prose paraphrase of Robert Browning's poem. Your paraphrase should be approximately as long as the poem-at least 350 words. Look up the meaning of any words that may be unfamiliar to you. This devilish and psychotic Duke is showing a go between person their treasured art items. The go between is here to arrange a meeting of the Duke with his master the Count.

1 Write in prose, not verse (in prose the lines go all the way to right margin). 2  The line breaks of the original are irrelevant in paraphrasing. 3  Write modern prose, rearranging word order and sentence structure as necessary. Here's the best definition I can come up with of a paraphrase: A piece of modern speech you can imagine the speaker of the original poem saying that conveys in different words exactly and fully every shade of meaning in the original poem, both what's said and what's implied..

Prose Definition. Prose is a form of language that has no formal metrical structure. It applies a natural flow of speech, and ordinary grammatical structure rather than rhythmic structure, such as in the case of traditional poetry. Normal every day speech is spoken in prose and most people think and write in prose form.

Write a prose paraphrase of the poem. There is no frigate like a book To take us lands away, Nor any coursers like a page Of prancing poetry.
